page.title: 01TOTLEY & ITS ENVIRONMENT
page.content: Woods,farmland,housing,the Poly tower blocks,a main road,the railway,all backed by the higher moorland beyond, appear to be the first impression of this area.A closer look reveals an area with a fascinating history and many interesting features,including ancient woods and houses,accommodation for the severely handicapped,a home for children in care,excellent walking country,Britain's second longest railway tunnel,a shooting range, kennels for unwanted dogs,and a pleasant residential area with homes which range from the single person's flat to the large mansion in its own grounds.A wide range of facilities provide for most of the locals' needs and for some of the needs of those who come for further education or just a good meal.
